title: Wilful violations; penalty
context: §387-7 Wilful violations; penalty. Any employer who wilfully hinders or delays the director of labor and industrial relations or the director&rsquo;s authorized representative in the performance of the director&rsquo;s duties in the enforcement of this chapter; or who wilfully refuses to admit the director or the director&rsquo;s authorized representative to any place of employment; or who fails to keep or who falsifies any record required under section 387-6 or who refuses to make such records accessible or to give information required for the proper enforcement of this chapter, upon demand, to the director or the director&rsquo;s authorized representative shall be fined not more than $500 or imprisoned not more than ninety days, or both. [L Sp 1941, c 66, pt of §5; RL 1945, §4357; RL 1955, §94-7; HRS §387-7; gen ch 1985] Cross References Classification of offense and authorized punishment, see §§701-107, 706-640, and 706-663.
